pullRequest.title: For #148: added SliceDelete
pullRequest.bodyText:
For #148:

added SliceDeleteTest testing two cases: deleting the passed key, and not deleting the key that was not passed
left puzzle to continue implementation.

nodes.bodyText: @paulodamaso why is there a key here? The key to delete should only come from the request (in response), not be pre-determined!

+/**

+ *  15 in pom.xml.
+ */
+@SuppressWarnings({"PMD.UnusedPrivateField", "PMD.SingularField"})

+

+     * @param key Key to delete.

+    public SliceDelete(final Storage storage, final Key key) {
+        this.storage = storage;
+        this.key = key;

nodes.bodyText: @paulodamaso if we need to work in a subdirectory of the storage, we can use Substorage for that, no need to introduce that responsibility in SliceDelete. As you can see SliceDownload and SliceUpload does not take care of that either.

nodes.bodyText: @paulodamaso why do we need to share the key between tests?
@paulodamaso this class can be package private

@paulodamaso I'd create private static method to build requires line instead of using constant - it will hide internal details from users and keep fewer shared data between tests, e.g. line(String path)

@paulodamaso response() returns async response which may be called later, please check this test to see how Slice can be tested: 
  
    
      http/src/test/java/com/artipie/http/slice/TrimPathSliceTest.java
    
    
         Line 137
      in
      5b0712c
    
    
    
    

        
          
           private static void verify(final Slice slice, final RequestLine line) throws Exception { 
        
    
  


Alternatively, you can verify that response has OK status using RsHasStatus Hamcrest matcher which is blocking waiting response to complete before checking the status.

+import org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert;
+import org.hamcrest.core.IsEqual;
+import org.junit.jupiter.api.Disabled;
+import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
+
+/**
+ * Tests for {@link SliceDelete}.
+ *
+ * @since 0.10
+ */
+public final class SliceDeleteTest {
+
+    /**
+     * Deleted key.
+     */
+    private static final String KEY = "deletedKey";
+
+    /**
+     * Delete method.
+     */
+    private static final String METHOD = "DELETE";
+
+    /**
+     * HTTP.
+     */
+    private static final String HTTP = "HTTP/1.1";
+
+    @Test
+    @Disabled
+    void deleteCorrectEntry() {
+        final Storage storage = new InMemoryStorage();
+        storage.save(
+            new Key.From(SliceDeleteTest.KEY),
+            new Content.From("deleted content".getBytes())
+        ).join();
+        new SliceDelete(
+            storage
+        ).response(
+            new RequestLine(
+                SliceDeleteTest.METHOD,
+                SliceDeleteTest.KEY,
+                SliceDeleteTest.HTTP
+            ).toString(),
+            Collections.emptyList(),
+            Flowable.empty()
+        );
+        MatcherAssert.assertThat(
+            storage.exists(new Key.From(SliceDeleteTest.KEY)),
+            new IsEqual<>(false)
+        );
+    }
+

+    @Disabled

+        final Storage storage = new InMemoryStorage();

+        storage.save(
+            new Key.From(SliceDeleteTest.KEY),
+            new Content.From("any content".getBytes())
+        ).join();
+        storage.save(
+            preserved,
+            new Content.From("preserved content".getBytes())
+        ).join();
+        new SliceDelete(
+            storage
+        ).response(

nodes.bodyText: @paulodamaso Storage.exists(Key) is async call which returns CompletableFuture<Boolean>, not boolean, it can't be tested against boolean. You can use Storage.exists(Key).toCompletableFuture().get() or new BlockingStorage(storage).exists(Key)
@paulodamaso same here: CompletionStage<Boolean> can't be compared with Boolean
